subject: AI & Agents
title: Anomaly Detection: Finding the Oddballs
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Anomaly Detection: Finding the Oddballs.

hook.text: One transaction among millions looks slightly unusual. The AI flags it. It's fraud worth $50,000.

buildup.text: Anomaly detection learns what 'normal' looks like and flags anything that deviates significantly.

discovery.text: It works without labeled examples of fraud â€” the model only needs to understand typical patterns.

twist.text: Setting the sensitivity threshold is tricky: too sensitive means false alarms, too lax means missed fraud.

climax.text: Banks, factories, and hospitals all use anomaly detection to catch problems before they escalate.

punchline.text: Find the needle in the haystack without knowing what the needle looks like.

quiz.question: How does anomaly detection work without labeled fraud examples?
options: It learns normal patterns and flags significant deviations
It memorizes every known fraud case
It randomly selects transactions to flag
